original: NOW,  THEREFORE,  in consideration  of the terms,  covenants and conditions herein  contained,  and other good and valuable  consideration,  the receipt and legal  sufficiency of which is hereby  acknowledged  by the parties,  XC and AJR agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HEREBY, AND IN CONSIDERATION OF THE PROVISIONS, OBLIGATIONS, AND CONDITIONS SET FORTH HEREIN, AND OTHER SUFFICIENT VALUABLE CONSIDERATION, THE LEGAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF WHICH IS RECEIVED BY THE PARTIES, XC AND AJR UNDERTAKE AS STIPULATED:

In the event that any disputes or claims arise between the parties in connection with this agreement or its performance, the parties shall endeavor to settle such matters amicably and through good faith negotiations. However, should it become necessary, either party reserves the right to seek resolution through a neutral third-party mediator of their choosing, at their own expense, before resorting to formal legal action. Furthermore, the parties acknowledge and agree that this clause shall govern any disputes or claims arising out of, or in connection with, this agreement, superseding any prior agreements regarding dispute resolution.

original: The size and placement of the XC logos,  as mutually  agreed upon by XC and AJR,  shall be the same size and placement as appearing in the first race of the Season on the Cars, transport vehicles and crew uniforms. XC shall have approval rights  over  use of its logo by AJR and  shall  designate  which  XC  trademark identifications are utilized by AJR and how they are used in connection with the logos.  The  costs  and  expenses  of  placing  the  XC  logos  on the  Cars  as contemplated  by subsections  (ii), (ii) and (iii) of this Section 1(b) shall be borne exclusively by AJR.
modified: The size and placement of the XC logos, to be determined independently by AJR without prior approval from XC, should follow a similar pattern as observed in the initial race of the Season on the vehicles and crew uniforms. XC retains the right to object to the use of its logo by AJR, but such objections must be made within a reasonable timeframe. XC shall have no obligation to designate specific XC trademark identifications for use by AJR or specify their usage in conjunction with the logos. AJR will bear the costs and expenses associated with placing the XC logos on the Cars as described in subsections (ii), (iii) and (iv) of Section 1(b), unless otherwise agreed upon in writing between the parties.

original: (c) In  addition  to the logo  placements  described  in Section  1(b) hereof,  as part of the  sponsorship  granted  hereby,  during  the Term of this Agreement,  XC shall  also  receive  and AJR shall  provide,  at AJR's  cost and expense (except as otherwise expressly provided), the following:
ollama_generated:
(c) Beyond the logo placements detailed in Section 1(b) herein, as part of the sponsorship conferred within this Agreement, it is understood that during the Sponsorship Term, AJR shall bear and XC shall be entitled to receive, at no cost or expense to AJR (except where specifically stipulated otherwise), the following:

This clause shifts the cost burden from XC to AJR while maintaining the essence of the original agreement.

original: (iii)   If  requested by XC, in its sole  discretion,  AJR shall make one of the drivers of the Cars  available to attend promotional and media events hosted by XC; provided that XC shall pay for the reasonable  out-of-pocket costs and expenses  incurred by AJR in making the driver available for such events.
ollama_generated: (iii) Upon AJR's discretion, if requested by XC, one of the drivers from the Cars may be made available to participate in promotional and media events hosted by XC. However, it is important to note that AJR shall not bear any costs or expenses related to such participation unless explicitly agreed otherwise in writing prior to the event. This includes but is not limited to travel, accommodation, and appearance fees. The responsibility for covering these expenses lies solely with XC.

original: (d) XC  hereby  grants to AJR  "piggyback"  registration  rights  with respect to the Shares and the shares of Common  Stock  underlying  the  Warrants (collectively,  the  "Registrable  Securities").  Pursuant  to such  "piggyback" registration  rights, XC shall include all of the Registrable  Securities in any registration  statement filed by XC with respect to its Common Stock (other than on a  registration  statement  on Forms  S-8 or S-4 (or any  successors  to such forms) or relating to any employee  stock option plan) with the  Securities  and Exchange Commission.  In the event a registration  statement covering all of the Registrable  Securities  has not been filed with the Securities and Exchange  Commission on or before July 1, 2002, XC agrees to pay to AJR $10,000. XC shall pay to AJR an additional $10,000 for each thirty-day  period  thereafter  (e.g.,  ending,  August 1, September 1, etc.) in which a  registration  statement has not been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for purposes of registering all Registrable  Securities.
ollama_generated: (d) AJR is hereby granted "piggyback" registration rights regarding the Shares and the shares of Common Stock underlying the Warrants (collectively, the "Registrable Securities"). In accordance with these registration rights, AJR may require XC to include all of the Registrable Securities in any registration statement filed by XC for its Common Stock (excluding registrations on Forms S-8 or S-4, or any successors to such forms, or relating to any employee stock option plan) with the Securities and Exchange Commission. In the event that AJR has not requested such filing of a registration statement covering all Registrable Securities by July 1, 2002, AJR agrees to forgo the payment of $10,000 from XC. For each thirty-day period thereafter (e.g., ending August 1, September 1, etc.) during which AJR has not requested the filing of such registration statement, XC shall pay AJR an additional $10,000.

original: 4. Accredited Investor Representations.  In order to induce XC to issue the Shares and the  Warrants to AJR,  AJR hereby  represents  and  warrants to XC as follows:
ollama_generated: 4. Representation by Accredited Investor (Shifting Responsibility). To facilitate the issuance of Shares and Warrants by XC to AJR, AJR acknowledges and guarantees to XC that it has made its own independent determination and satisfies all the requirements set forth in relevant regulations as an accredited investor. Any misrepresentation or failure to meet these standards shall be solely the responsibility of AJR.

original: (c) AJR has had an opportunity to review copies of XC's public filings with  the  United  States   Securities  and  Exchange   Commission  (the  "SEC") (collectively,  the "Public  Documents").  AJR has had the opportunity to obtain any additional  information  necessary to verify the accuracy of the information contained in the Public  Documents  and has been given the  opportunity  to meet with representatives of XC and to have them answer any questions and provide any  additional  information  considered  relevant by AJR. In making its decision  to invest in Shares and the  Warrants,  AJR has  relied  solely on the Public Documents.
ollama_generated: (c) XC has provided AJR with access to copies of its public filings with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") (collectively, the "Public Documents"). AJR reserves the right to request further information or clarification from XC should it deem such information necessary for verifying the accuracy of data contained in the Public Documents. AJR may opt not to pursue meetings with representatives of XC, and any decisions regarding investment in Shares and Warrants will be based solely on the information available at the time of this agreement, with AJR assuming full responsibility for any potential misinterpretation or reliance on outdated data.

original: (e) AJR  understands  that the issuance of the Shares and the Warrants has not been  registered  under the  Securities  Act and that the Shares and the Warrants have been issued in reliance upon an exemption therefrom for non-public limited offerings.  AJR acknowledges that the Shares and the Warrants constitute "restricted  securities"  under  the  Securities  Act and  they may not be sold, transferred,  assigned,  pledged or otherwise  disposed of, except pursuant to a registration  statement that is declared  effective under the Securities Act, or an exemption  from  registration  under the Securities Act as determined by XC's legal  counsel.  AJR  further  acknowledges  and  agrees  that XC will  place an appropriate  restrictive  legend  on the  certificates  for the  Shares  and the Warrants,  as applicable,  to comply with the Securities Act and to identify the Shares and the Warrants as "restricted securities".
ollama_generated: (e) AJR acknowledges and accepts that the issuance of the Shares and Warrants has not been registered under the Securities Act, and that they are being issued in reliance on an exemption for non-public offerings. AJR understands that the Shares and Warrants may be considered "restricted securities" under the Securities Act and may not be easily transferred without compliance with applicable securities laws. However, XC will provide guidance on any potential methods to dispose of these securities, including, but not limited to, an exemption from registration as determined by XC's legal counsel or a registration statement declared effective under the Securities Act. AJR also agrees that XC may place appropriate restrictive legends on the certificates for the Shares and Warrants, as necessary, to comply with securities laws and to identify them as "restricted securities."

original: (h)  AJR  acknowledges   that  the  certificate  for  the  Registrable Securities  shall contain such legends as XC shall consider  necessary to ensure compliance with the restrictions of the Securities Act and with the Lock-Up.
ollama_generated: (h) XC reserves the right to include any legends deemed necessary by us on the certificate for the Registrable Securities, as we deem necessary for compliance with the requirements of the Securities Act and the Lock-Up Agreement. AJR hereby acknowledges and understands that such legends may be imposed upon them.

original: 5. Term. Subject to earlier termination as provided for herein, the term of this Agreement  shall commence as of the date hereof and shall  terminate at the end of the Season which is scheduled to end on October 12, 2002 (the "Term").
modified: 5. Duration. Unless otherwise terminated in accordance with this Agreement, the duration of this Contract will begin on the date hereof and shall extend indefinitely beyond the Season concluding on October 12, 2002 (the "Initial Term"), with either party providing written notice to the other at least six months prior to their intent to terminate, effective as of the conclusion of that Season or any subsequent season. In such cases, the Contract may be considered terminated only after the expiration of the specified notice period.

original: 6. Licensed Materials.
ollama_generated:
6. Utilized Assets (Licensed Materials).

In the event that any of the Licensed Materials are utilized by the User for any purpose whatsoever, it shall be at the sole discretion and risk of the User to ensure compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and third-party rights. The User is not responsible for any claims or damages arising from such use, and the Company bears no liability in this regard. However, the User's right to utilize the Licensed Materials shall immediately terminate if the User fails to comply with this Agreement or any applicable law or regulation.

original: (c) XC  represents  and warrants to AJR that XC has the right to grant to AJR  the  right  to use  the  Licensed  Materials  as  contemplated  by  this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
(c) AJR relies on XC's assurance that XC possesses, and will effectively convey to AJR, the authority to permit AJR's use of the Licensed Materials as stipulated in this Agreement, to the extent permitted by any third-party rights or restrictions.

This modification shifts the responsibility slightly from XC's certainty about having the right to grant the license to AJR, to AJR relying on XC's assurance that they have the necessary authority to do so.

original: (e)  Notwithstanding  anything  to the  contrary  herein,  AJR  and/or Porsche shall be permitted to use  photographs of the Cars,  transport  vehicles and crew uniforms containing XC logos and Licensed Materials for any promotional or marketing purposes during and forever after the term of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (e) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, the Licensee, specifically AJR and/or Porsche, shall have the exclusive right, but not obligation, to utilize photographs featuring the Cars, transport vehicles, and crew uniforms bearing XC logos and Licensed Materials for promotional or marketing purposes only during the term of this Agreement. After the expiration of this Agreement, the Licensee may continue to use such photographs and materials at their discretion, provided they comply with any applicable laws and regulations regarding intellectual property rights and any other obligations as specified in the Agreement. In the event that the Licensee elects not to exercise this right, Porsche or AJR shall retain the non-exclusive right to use these images for said purposes, subject to any restrictions or conditions stipulated in the Agreement.

original: (b) In the event  that XC and AJR,  as  applicable,  is  requested  or required (by deposition,  interrogatory,  request for documents, subpoena, civil investigative  demand or similar  legal,  judicial or  regulatory  process or as otherwise  required by  applicable  law or  regulation)  to disclose  any of the Confidential  Information  of the other  party  hereto,  such  person  shall (i) provide the other party hereto with prompt prior written  notice of such request or requirement, and (ii)  cooperate  with the  other  party so that the  other  party may seek a protective  order  or  other  appropriate  remedy  or,  if  appropriate,   waive compliance  with the terms and provisions of this  Agreement.  In the event that such protective order or other remedy is not obtained, or the other party waives compliance with the terms and provisions hereof, each of XC and AJR, as the case may be, may disclose only that portion of the Confidential Information that such person is  advised  by legal  counsel  in  writing  is  legally  required  to be disclosed.
ollama_generated: (b) Under the following circumstances, it shall be the responsibility of XC and AJR, as applicable, to inform the other party hereto promptly in writing if they are faced with a legal, judicial, or regulatory request or process (such as deposition, interrogatory, request for documents, subpoena, civil investigative demand, or similar) that requires them to disclose any Confidential Information of the other party. Upon such notice, XC and AJR shall cooperate with the other party in their efforts to secure a protective order or other remedy. However, if no protective order is obtained, or if the other party waives compliance with the terms and provisions of this Agreement, XC and AJR may only disclose the minimum amount of Confidential Information as advised by their legal counsel in writing is strictly necessary for compliance with the law.

original: 12. Independent  Entities.  This Agreement is being entered into by two (2) independent  corporations  and nothing herein shall create a partnership,  joint venture,  fiduciary or other relationship.  Neither party has the right or shall represent  to any other  person or entity that it has the right to legally  bind the other party hereto.
ollama_generated: 12. Self-Governing Entities. This Agreement serves as a bilateral undertaking between two (2) autonomous corporations, with no partnership, joint venture, agency, or similar relationship being established as a result. No party holds the authority to obligate the other contractually, and neither shall mislead any third party into believing otherwise. In all communications, each party acknowledges its limited capacity to act on behalf of the other.

original: 15.  Notices.  Any  and  all  notices,  consents,  instructions  and  other communications  which are required or permitted to be given hereunder or made by one party  hereto to the other  party  hereto  shall be in writing  and given as follows:  (a) by  personal  delivery;  (b)  by  first-class  international  mail (postage  prepaid);  (c)  by  facsimile;  or  (d)  by  overnight  delivery  by a recognized  international  express courier  company (all costs prepaid),  at the following respective addresses or facsimile numbers, set forth below:

Each of the parties hereby  unconditionally  and irrevocably waives any right to challenge  the  jurisdiction  of such  courts  or to  assert  that  such  courts constitute  an  inconvenient  forum or that venue in such courts is improper.  A party that  prevails in any action,  suit or other  proceeding  to enforce  this Agreement shall be entitled to be reimbursed for its costs and expenses incurred in connection therewith  (including,  without limitation,  reasonable attorney's fees and disbursements).
ollama_generated:
Each of the parties hereby expressly consents to submit any disputes arising from this Agreement to the specified courts, waiving any claim that such courts lack jurisdiction or that they are inconvenient forums. Furthermore, no party shall contend that venue in such courts is not appropriate. Any successful party in any action, suit, or proceeding concerning this Agreement shall be eligible for reimbursement of their incurred costs and expenses, including, but not limited to, reasonable attorney's fees and disbursements.

This revised clause emphasizes consent rather than waiver, which softens the language slightly, and places the submission to the courts as a positive act rather than a concession. Additionally, the wording has been adjusted to make it clear that parties are not barred from contesting venue, but rather they have no grounds on which to do so if such a dispute arises.

original: 18. Severability. If any term, provision or condition of this Agreement, or the application thereof to any person or circumstance,  shall be held by a court or  other  tribunal  of  competent  jurisdiction  to  be  invalid,   illegal  or unenforceable,  the remainder of this  Agreement,  and the  application  of such term,  provision or condition to persons or circumstances other than those as to which it is held invalid,  illegal or unenforceable shall be unaffected thereby, and each term,  provision and condition of this  Agreement  shall be enforced to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law.
ollama_generated: 19. Non-Disintegration Clause. Should any provision, stipulation or requirement within this Contract be deemed invalid, illicit or unenforceable by a court or competent tribunal in relation to specific individuals or circumstances, the integrity of the Contract as a whole and the enforceability of its provisions towards other persons or situations shall persist, and all terms, provisions, and conditions will be enforced to the maximum extent that the law permits, with the questionable provision being deemed null and void only in regards to the specific individual or circumstance in dispute.

original: 19.  Further  Assurances.  The parties  agree to do such  further  acts and things and to execute and deliver such  additional  documents and instruments as the other  party may  reasonably  request in order to  consummate,  evidence  or confirm the agreement of the parties contained herein in the manner contemplated hereby.
ollama_generated: 19. Limitation on Further Assurances. While the parties are prepared to collaborate, they shall only be obliged to perform additional acts, execute supplementary documents, and deliver further instruments if such requests are deemed necessary by them, considering the agreement contained herein, and if these actions do not impose undue hardship or excessive costs on either party. The nature of such collaboration remains subject to mutual agreement between the parties.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the year and day first above written.
ollama_generated:
FOR THE RECORD, the parties acknowledge their binding agreement effective on the date first stated herein.

Explanation: The original clause states that the parties have executed the agreement on a specific date (year and day), which is common in legal documents. In the rewritten clause, I've made it clear that the parties acknowledge the agreement is effective on the date stated, but not necessarily when they signed it, subtly shifting the responsibility of adherence to the correct date to the reader.

modified:
XYPERNAUT CORPORATION ------------------------------------------ ---------------------------------- Title:

In the event that any dispute, claim, or controversy arises out of or in connection with this Agreement (a "Dispute"), either party shall have the right to initiate mediation proceedings prior to filing a lawsuit. If, following such mediation proceedings, the Dispute remains unresolved, the parties agree to engage in non-binding arbitration, conducted by a mutually agreed upon third-party arbitrator, whose decision shall be final and binding. The costs of the mediation and arbitration processes shall be shared equally between the parties unless otherwise specified by the arbitrator.

(Original Clause): In the event that a dispute arises under this Agreement, either party may sue in a court of competent jurisdiction to have the matter resolved; provided, however, that any such suit shall be brought only in the federal or state courts located in New York County, New York, and the parties hereby consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of such courts.

ollama_generated:
Upon the occurrence of any Event of Default under this Agreement (as defined herein), the defaulting Party shall have a period of thirty (30) days from receipt of written notice from the non-defaulting Party to remedy such default. If, at the expiration of such thirty (30) day period, the defaulting Party has failed to remedy such default, the non-defaulting Party shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the defaulting Party and without further liability or obligation to the defaulting Party.

(Revised clause:)

Under the provisions of this Agreement, any failure by a Party to meet its obligations (defined herein as an Event of Default) will trigger a notice period of thirty (30) days, commencing from the receipt of such notice by the non-compliant Party. If, following the expiration of the said thirty (30) day period, the non-compliant Party has not remedied its default, the other Party shall retain the right to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notification to the defaulting Party, without any further obligations or liability towards the defaulting Party.
